result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas E Stein

CALL:  9-15-2022 @ 10:45 in Br 3
Same bond to continue
OSPD Appt of Counsel report

from Jeff, JSS    re: Case / Release plan
Per TWB:  Approved

State by gomez in person /  Def by phone Pro Se /  Jeff S., JSS by video
CRT:  continuance of a bail/bond Hrg - an updated plan for modified bond was submitted
State comments on plan - too broad...
CRT:  at last Hrg he stated he could not make a plan in advance.  A log could be set up & matched up to GPS...
Jeff S:  he told me he does a lot of door to door work.  Knocking on doors to see if they need work - it would be difficult to verify each address
CRT:  if it was log it could be verified by GPS monitoring.  Log / GPS would be consistent w/ what he is reporting
Jeff S:  we ould need him to write down all addresses as to where he is going
Def comments on coming to WI for family events
CRT:  You can come to WI for work.  JSS could approve you coming to WI for family events
Jeff S:  we could work w/ def if CRT gives us authority
CRT:  understands State's concerns - if he deviates, he would lose his right to come to WI
State: he has done something similar.  I did not charge him for violating his bond.  I want it clear that he will be charged if he violated his bond
Def:  yes, my Atty can deal w/ that - I don't recall bond violation
CRT:  DEF IS TO KEEP A JOURNAL/LOG ON WHAT TIME & WHERE HE GOES FOR WORK WHEN COMING INTO LA CROSSE.  WRITE DOWN WHAT BLOCK/STREET NAME OF WHERE YOU ARE GOING TO.  WRITE DOWN THE LOCATION & NAME OF BUSINESS YOU GO TO.  IF YOU LEAVE FOR LUNCH, WRITE DOWN TIME & BUSINESS AS TO WHERE YOU WENT
CRT:  JSS to update plan to include log/journal.  I would authorize bond to be changed based on this plan
Def comments on IRS for employment verification.  Can I be on the water?  I own boat
State:  I'm not sure how GPS can track that, I do have concerns that it is public area
CRT:  he has to come to WI to get to Pettibone Park
Def:  I will go there regularly once I move to La Crescent.  My dad has boathouse & boat at Pettibone.  I go to Pettibone Beach to boat club
State:  I did ask that he let JSS know when he goes to Pettibone
CRT:  you need to put times you go to Pettibone in your log/journal.  This will be added to the plan.  You may visit w/ father @ houseboat, you can go on waterways from that point but cannot dock on WI side othe4r than Pettibone.  You are allowed to come to WI for work, if you are incompliance & prove yourself I will reconsider
CRT:  JSS to add amendments & I will have the JA add plan to bond.  Def's next CRT date is 8-24-2022 @ 10:45
Def:  I am meeting w/ an atty on Friday
CRT:  date can be changed if you retain counsel
from Jeff, JSS   re: Release Plan

State by Ruud by video /  Def pro se by phone /  Jeff, JSS by video
CRT:  Pub Def filed letter on 7-26 staing they have made over 700 contacts.  Def is living on MN, def filed a letter, has State reviewed letter?
Stein:  I am looking to move to La Crescent.  I do storm restoration.  I want to have my own business, I am not licensed in MN - I am looking at retaining Atty Pierce
State:  reviewed letter.  In terms of def coming into State, it was for JSS to be notified.  This has been in effect for several months, due to time of his plans, his requests were denied.  When given permission to enter State, def was not in area where he told JSS he would be.  Def violated the exclusion zones.  While the State is empathetic def needs to show he can comply w/ terms of his bond.  We see this as him manipulating bond/restrictions
CRT:  part of request is that he be allowed to move to WI
State:  it would depend on the plan.  If he moves to La Crescent, that would not be violation.  We would not have an objection for him coming into State of WI for employment.  This would have to be discussed w/ JSS
Stein:  this is not a normal situation.  I run the entire company & I have to go meet w/ people that day.  I work w/ insurance company
CRT:  you may be restricted w/ certain hours or areas.  You could not take jobs in exclusion zones/areas
Jeff S:  2 exclusion for victims set up & the exclusion zone for entire State of WI.  If he is allowed to come to WI for work, exclusion zones could be in place for the victims
CRT:  put together written plan w/ JSS
Jeff S:  I could speak w/ def today & have plan to you by tomorrow
CRT:  Bail/Bond Hrg 8-3-2022 @ 1:15 - CRT will recycle Zoom info
Bail/bond hearing on August 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Calendar call on August 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.

from JSS   re: TWB has stated that def is no longer authorized to come into State of WI w/o prior written permission from CRT.  I spoke w/ def yesterday & he expressed plans to move to La Crescent & work in WI. I reminded def of TWB response & he argued that response only applied to family events & JSS could still approve him to come to WI for employment.  Please provide clarification

from JSS   re: Def is reporting that at his CRT Hrg on 5-18-2022 he was approved to come to WI for any reason, not just work.  I reviewed his bond conditions & I don't see that there was any update.
